page.title: 08EDUCATION IN MARSHFIELD
page.content: The primary school has 100 pupils aged from 4 1/2 to 11, in 4 classes; it has a headmaster and 4 teachers. The children are taught basic skills of communication, reading, writing and number work. These are enriched by studies of History, Geography, Practical Science, Music, the Local Environment, including visits, and various sports. There is a strong community involvement and parents are encouraged to take an active interest. The International School of Choueifat is a co-educational boarding school, opened in 1983 at Ashwicke Hall. The children are mostly from the Lebanon, aged 5-18. They are taught Maths, English, Science, Social Studies, PE, all in English, but Arabic is also taught. Some teachers are Lebanese, but most staff are British.
